1   package org.openimaj.demos.sandbox.tldcpp.videotld;
2   
3   import java.util.List;
4   
5   import org.openimaj.demos.sandbox.tldcpp.detector.NormalizedPatch;
6   import org.openimaj.demos.sandbox.tldcpp.detector.ScaleIndexRectangle;
7   import org.openimaj.image.FImage;
8   import org.openimaj.image.processing.algorithm.MeanCenter;
9   import org.openimaj.image.processing.resize.ResizeProcessor;
10  import org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.Rectangle;
11  
12  /**
13   * Variaus TLD utility functions
14   * @author Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
15   *
16   */
17  public class TLDUtil {
18  	
19  	/**
20  	 * Resize image to fit in a {@link NormalizedPatch#TLD_PATCH_SIZE} squared image and mean center 
21  	 * @param img
22  	 * @return new (image.process is called) image
23  	 */
24  	public static FImage tldNormalizeImg(FImage img) {
25  		int size = NormalizedPatch.TLD_PATCH_SIZE;
26  		
27  //		resize(img, result, cvSize(size,size)); //Default is bilinear
28  		ResizeProcessor resizeProc = new ResizeProcessor(size, size, false);
29  		FImage result = img.process(resizeProc);
30  		result.processInplace(new MeanCenter());
31  		return result;
32  	}
33  
34  	
35  
36  	/**
37  	 * {@link #tldOverlapNorm(Rectangle, Rectangle)} called on every window and boundary.
38  	 * @param windows
39  	 * @param numWindows
40  	 * @param boundary
41  	 * @param overlap
42  	 */
43  	public static void tldOverlap(Rectangle[] windows, int numWindows, Rectangle boundary,float[] overlap) {
44  		for(int i = 0; i < numWindows; i++) {
45  			overlap[i] = (float) tldOverlapNorm(windows[i],boundary);
46  		}
47  	}
48  
49  	/**
50  	 * {@link Rectangle#overlapping(Rectangle)} called and normalised by:
51  	 * 
52  	 * @param A
53  	 * @param B
54  	 * @return intersect / (areaA + areaB - intersect)
55  	 */
56  	public static float tldOverlapNorm(Rectangle A, Rectangle B) {
57  		Rectangle overlap = A.overlapping(B);
58  		double intersect = overlap == null ? 0 : overlap.calculateArea();
59  		double areaA = A.calculateArea();
60  		double areaB = B.calculateArea();
61  		
62  		return (float) (intersect / (areaA + areaB - intersect));
63  	}
64  
65  	/**
66  	 * The overlap of the window at the firstIndex to all windows in the confidentIndices
67  	 * @param windows
68  	 * @param firstIndex
69  	 * @param confidentIndices
70  	 * @param distances
71  	 * @param distIDX
72  	 */
73  	public static void tldOverlapOne(ScaleIndexRectangle[] windows, int firstIndex, List<Integer> confidentIndices, float[] distances, int distIDX) {
74  		Rectangle comp = windows[firstIndex];
75  		int i = 0;
76  		for (int idx : confidentIndices) {
77  			ScaleIndexRectangle other = windows[idx];
78  			distances[distIDX + i] = tldOverlapNorm(comp,other);
79  			i++;
80  		}
81  	}
82  }
